job_info.role_description: Work on data preprocessing, cleaning, and transforming raw data for modeling; collaborate on optimizing ML models; participate in training and fine-tuning models; conduct research on AI/ML techniques; document development; provide AI/ML-driven solutions; assist in deployment pipelines and implementation of ML models
preferred_skills: Understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms
Exposure to AI/ML through academic projects, internships, or online courses
job_responsibilities: Work on data preprocessing, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a usable format for modeling
Collaborate with senior engineers to optimize machine learning models for performance and scalability
Participate in the training and fine-tuning of models to improve accuracy and efficiency
Conduct research on emerging AI/ML techniques and contribute to proof-of-concept development
Document model development, research, and performance metrics for future reference and learning
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business problems and provide AI/ML-driven solutions
Assist in developing deployment pipelines for ML models, ensuring they are scalable and efficient
Assist in the development and implementation of machine learning models for various business applications

questions.question: In scikit-learn, which preprocessing utility is most appropriate for converting a categorical column with unordered categories into a numeric array for a tree-based model?
2. You create a DataFrame with 100k rows and call drop_duplicates(). What is the most memory-efficient way to perform this operation in-place?
3. Which Keras API sequence correctly adds a 64-unit dense layer with ReLU followed by a 10-unit softmax layer to a Sequential model?
4. In TensorFlow 2.x, which callback allows automatic saving of the model with the best validation loss during training?
5. When fine-tuning a PyTorch model on a small dataset, which technique is commonly used to keep pretrained low-level features intact while allowing higher layers to adapt?

options.text: Freeze all layers except the final classifier layer
Unfreeze all layers and train with a very high learning rate
Convert the model to eval() mode permanently

questions.question: 6. Which SQL clause is required whenever you use an aggregate function like COUNT() alongside non-aggregated columns?
7. A git command sequence that correctly pushes a new local branch named feat to the remote and sets upstream is:
8. In scikit-learn, which parameter controls the maximum depth of a DecisionTreeClassifier to reduce over-fitting?
9. You observe exploding gradients in a deep RNN written in Keras. Which simple weight-constraint technique can you apply inside the layer definition to mitigate this?
10. To convert a PyTorch tensor to a NumPy array without copying memory, you should:
11. When joining two pandas DataFrames on columns that contain NaNs, which join type guarantees that no NaN keys are matched?

options.text: NaNs are always matched regardless of join type

questions.question: 12. Which TensorFlow function is the recommended entry point to load image data stored in subdirectories as a labeled dataset for training?
13. In scikit-learn pipelines, which estimator is specifically designed to pass through columns unchanged while allowing others to be transformed?
14. To enable gradient accumulation across 4 mini-batches in PyTorch, you should:
15. Which Git command safely moves your latest commit back to the staging area without changing the project files?
